intro: Oedera spinescens, commonly known as the spiny oedera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Oedera spinescens thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a habitat for small organisms.
